climbs.name: The Stiffy (on the Woody)
climbs.fa: Todd Gordon, Cyndie Bransford, Randy Vogel, Sarah Vogel, Tom Burke, Maria, Linda Kevin Bransford, Harry Star - Sept 1994

content.description:
Located on the Woody (the pointy boulder-esque pinnacle to the right of the Slanta Claus).

Climb crack features to face with one bolt.

Rappel from summit.
content.location: Located on the pinnacle in front of the right side of Slanta Claus Rock.

climbs.name: Slanta Claus Right
climbs.fa: Alan Roberts and Todd Gordon, January 1988

content.description: This is a very knobby crack, and a bit loose.
content.location: This is an obvious left-arching crack near the right side of the face.

content.description:
A chunky left slanting crack with big holds and coarse rock.

Step off the boulders and if you've been naughty or nice, climb for the top.
content.location:
Just right of the short Return of the Mimmster.

Left side of the Slanta Claus formation.

content.description:
Thin crack that trends left. It has a few face moves and wider jams thrown in for variety. As the name would imply, it is the middle of the three, left-leaning Slanta Claus cracks. Not a bad route if you are in the area.

Easy and obvious walk off.
content.location: Up and right of Worthwhile Piles. Access by climbing one of those lower tier routes. You can also rap down from one of those routes.

content.description: Good steep knobby/crack climb with fun moves.
content.protection: Bring some smaller stuff for the crux.
content.location: Behind and right of Worthwhile  Pile you will see a steeper wall behind a pillar. This is Slanta Claus Rock.On the far left side is this wall is the route.
